refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: implicitplot3d(fun, [x_range, [y_range, [z_range]]]) implicitplot3d(fun, x_range, y_range, z_range, [options]) implicitplot3d(f_eval, x_range, y_range, z_range, [options])

listitem.para: a string or a function of variables x, y and z. The function to plot.
a real hypermatrix of size [length(x_range), length(y_range), length(z_range)]. The evaluation of the function to plot on all points in x_range, y_range and z_range.
a real vector. The x values over which the function is sampled.
a real vector. The y values over which the function is sampled.
a real vector. The z values over which the function is sampled.
a list of options. The plot3d optional parameters.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: implicitplot3d(fun, x_range, y_range, z_range) draws the implicit function defined by fun(x, y, z) = 0 by evaluating fun over x_range, y_range and z_range to detect zero crossings.
If x_range, y_range or z_range is omitted, the range chosen is 25 points taken in $[-1, 1]$.
The function fun may be defined as a compiled scilab function, an uncompiled function or a string. The function must take x, y and z as input parameters.
The options defined by the options parameter can be any options of the plot3d function.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: // Draw a circle of radius 1 implicitplot3d("x^2 + y^2 + z^2 - 1")
